revised_title: The Effect of Acids on the Rate of Decomposition of Hydrogen Peroxide by Hemase
tldr: The author investigates the effect of various acids on the rate of hydrogen peroxide decomposition by hemase, an enzyme found in blood. Results show that while hydrochloric and nitric acids significantly slow down the reaction, other acids like benzoic, succinic, and acetic acids have a lesser effect. The study also suggests that negative ions may influence enzyme activity.
